Pivotal Labs News - April 2014
Welcome to the Monthly Pivotal Labs Newsletter! Thank you for taking the time to read the monthly Pivotal Labs newsletter, where we share our leading technology insights, how we're expanding our practice to do more for our customers, and invite you to meet us at upcoming industry conferences. Please feel free to email me directly <mailto:ijaffer@pivotallabs.com?Subject=Pivotal%20Labs%20Newsletter> if you have any questions, suggestions, or feedback. Thanks again for reading!
Imtiaz Jaffer, Director of Marketing
Edward Hieatt at Launch Festival <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iQWewHd30T8&feature=youtu.be>
Pivotal Labs COO Edward Hieatt spoke at LAUNCH Festival on February 24. He discussed how Pivotal Labs has been at the forefront of agile development in building highly reliable, scalable software for emerging companies across a number of industries.
Watch his talk here <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iQWewHd30T8&feature=youtu.be>.
Toronto Relocation A short 6 months following the acquisition of Xtreme Labs in Toronto, the team, formerly located at 69 Yonge Street, moved just a couple of blocks down the street to a new location. Fitting that we’re now located on Toronto Street. True to the Pivotal way, we have a large, 45,000 square foot open space spread across two floors. The office has amazing 360 degree views of the city and Lake Ontario and currently houses over 300 people with more to come! We look forward to seeing you at one of our upcoming meetups or events. If you’d like to schedule a tour, feel free to reach out.
Labs in London On March 5th, we hosted customers and partners for our official UK launch party. The London office is our first for the EMEA region and is located in what’s referred to as "The Silicon Roundabout." We were pleased to host companies such as Capital One, Barclays, TRG, Deutsche Bank, MBNL and others to celebrate the recent addition to the Pivotal family of locations and look forward to building on our presence in London. If you’re in the area, please stop by to say hello.
Deploying Apps to Cloud Foundry <http://pivotallabs.com/deploying-jruby-rails-application-cloud-foundry/> Want to deploy a Rails app to "the cloud?" Here are 5 steps to get your app on Cloud Foundry. Read the full blog <http://pivotallabs.com/deploying-jruby-rails-application-cloud-foundry/>.
The Advent of Aereo <http://pivotallabs.com/advent-aereo/>
Decades ago, antennas were the popular television signal of choice: they picked up over-the-air (OTA) signals that would display images on your TV. When cable brought high-quality television to the masses, it gradually absorbed the popularity of OTA signals. But a few years ago, the government and broadcasters breathed new life into OTA.
Read the full blog <http://pivotallabs.com/advent-aereo/>.
Android’s take on TDD <http://pivotallabs.com/tdd-android-pov/>
Test-driven development is an iterative process of writing automated tests that define a feature before development, writing code to pass the tests, and finally refactoring the code to meet project architecture standards.
Read the full blog <http://pivotallabs.com/tdd-android-pov/>.
